title: Beginner's Guided Session
description: Your complete introduction to sauna wellness
rationale: Moderate heat and lower humidity make it comfortable for first-timers while still providing sauna benefits

pre-sauna-steps.title: Pre-Sauna Shower
pre-sauna-steps.description: Take a warm shower and cleanse your body before entering the sauna
pre-sauna-steps.info: Showering removes dirt, oils, and lotions from your skin, which helps your body sweat more efficiently and maintains sauna hygiene for all users.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Hydration Check
pre-sauna-steps.description: Drink 250-500ml of water before starting
pre-sauna-steps.info: Pre-hydration is crucial as you'll lose significant fluids through sweating. Starting well-hydrated helps maintain blood pressure and prevents dizziness.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Stove Setup Tutorial
pre-sauna-steps.description: Learn how to configure your Harvia stove settings
pre-sauna-steps.info: Understanding your stove controls allows you to customize temperature, timer settings, and safety features for an optimal experience.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 1: Gentle Start
sauna-steps.description: Enter sauna, sit on lower bench, relax and breathe
sauna-steps.info: Starting on the lower bench where it's cooler allows your body to gradually adjust to the heat. This prevents overwhelming your cardiovascular system.

sauna-steps.title: Cool Down 1
sauna-steps.description: Exit sauna, cool down gradually - start standing, then sit outside
sauna-steps.info: Gradual cooling prevents sudden drops in blood pressure. Standing first helps circulation adjust, then sitting allows for comfortable cooling.

sauna-steps.title: Hydration Break
sauna-steps.description: Drink 250ml of water
sauna-steps.info: Regular hydration between intervals replaces lost fluids and electrolytes, helping maintain energy levels and preventing dehydration symptoms.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 2: Build Heat
sauna-steps.description: Re-enter sauna, try middle bench. Add water to stones for steam (optional)
sauna-steps.info: Throwing water (löyly) on hot stones creates steam, increasing humidity and perceived heat. This enhances sweating and provides a traditional Finnish experience.

sauna-steps.title: Cool Down 2
sauna-steps.description: Cool down outside, take a cool shower if desired, walk around gently
sauna-steps.info: Moving gently during cooldown promotes circulation and helps your body regulate temperature. A cool shower can accelerate the cooling process.

sauna-steps.title: Hydration Break
sauna-steps.description: Drink 250ml of water
sauna-steps.info: Continued hydration is essential. By this point, you've lost significant fluids, and maintaining intake prevents fatigue and headaches.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 3: Full Experience
sauna-steps.description: Final round - try upper bench. Add steam for peak intensity
sauna-steps.info: The upper bench is hottest due to heat rising. Your body is now acclimatized and can handle the increased temperature for maximum benefits.

sauna-steps.title: Final Cool Down
sauna-steps.description: Cool down completely - shower, sit, and relax until body temperature normalizes
sauna-steps.info: A longer final cooldown allows your body to fully recover. Complete cooling before getting dressed prevents continued sweating and ensures comfort.

sauna-steps.title: Post-Sauna Hydration
sauna-steps.description: Drink 500ml of water over the next 30 minutes
sauna-steps.info: Post-sauna hydration helps restore fluid balance and supports recovery. Spread intake over time for better absorption.

title: Athletic Recovery Session
description: Optimize muscle recovery and reduce soreness after training
rationale: Warmer temperature enhances muscle relaxation and blood flow; moderate humidity supports the contrast therapy protocol

pre-sauna-steps.title: Recovery Timing
pre-sauna-steps.description: Wait 45-60 minutes after intense exercise before starting
pre-sauna-steps.info: Allow your heart rate and core temperature to normalize after training. Entering the sauna too soon after intense exercise can overstress your cardiovascular system.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Pre-Sauna Shower
pre-sauna-steps.description: Take a warm shower to rinse off sweat and prepare muscles
pre-sauna-steps.info: Washing away workout sweat and warming muscles with a shower helps prepare your body for the sauna while maintaining hygiene.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Recovery Hydration
pre-sauna-steps.description: Drink 500ml of water. Optional: with electrolytes
pre-sauna-steps.info: Post-workout hydration is critical. Electrolytes help restore minerals lost through sweat during both exercise and sauna use, supporting muscle function and recovery.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Light Mobility Work
pre-sauna-steps.description: Gentle stretching or foam rolling of worked muscle groups
pre-sauna-steps.info: Light mobility work before the sauna helps identify tight areas and prepares muscles to better absorb the heat therapy benefits. Focus on areas that feel especially tight or sore.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 1: Deep Muscle Warming
sauna-steps.description: Enter sauna, sit comfortably, focus on deep breathing and muscle relaxation
sauna-steps.info: Longer initial interval increases blood flow to muscles, delivering oxygen and nutrients while removing metabolic waste. Heat penetrates deep into muscle tissue, promoting relaxation and reducing soreness.

sauna-steps.title: Contrast Cool Down 1
sauna-steps.description: Cold shower (1-2 min) or cold plunge, then rest at room temperature
sauna-steps.info: Contrast therapy (hot-cold alternation) reduces inflammation, flushes metabolic waste, and may decrease muscle soreness. The cold constricts blood vessels while heat dilates them, creating a pumping effect.

sauna-steps.title: Hydration & Breathing
sauna-steps.description: Drink 250-350ml of water, practice deep breathing
sauna-steps.info: Proper hydration maintains blood volume for optimal circulation to recovering muscles. Deep breathing helps activate parasympathetic nervous system, enhancing recovery.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 2: Circulation Boost
sauna-steps.description: Re-enter sauna, apply gentle steam. Focus on relaxing tight muscle groups
sauna-steps.info: The second heat interval further increases blood flow and helps release muscle tension. Heat shock proteins produced during sauna use may aid in muscle repair and adaptation.

sauna-steps.title: Contrast Cool Down 2
sauna-steps.description: Cold exposure (1-2 min), then gentle movement and rest
sauna-steps.info: Repeated contrast therapy maximizes the recovery benefits. Light movement during rest periods helps maintain circulation without overexertion.

sauna-steps.title: Recovery Hydration
sauna-steps.description: Drink 250-350ml of water with electrolytes
sauna-steps.info: Electrolyte replacement becomes increasingly important as session progresses. Sodium, potassium, and magnesium support muscle function and prevent cramping.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 3: Final Recovery Round
sauna-steps.description: Final sauna round, moderate steam, total relaxation focus
sauna-steps.info: The final interval consolidates recovery benefits. Your muscles are now fully warmed and relaxed, maximizing the therapeutic effects of heat therapy.

sauna-steps.title: Final Cool Down & Stretch
sauna-steps.description: Gradual cooling, optional cold exposure, gentle full-body stretching
sauna-steps.info: Muscles are most pliable when warm. Post-sauna stretching can improve flexibility and reduce next-day stiffness. Cool gradually to avoid sudden blood pressure changes.

sauna-steps.title: Recovery Nutrition Window
sauna-steps.description: Drink 500ml water, consider protein/recovery nutrition within 30 minutes
sauna-steps.info: Post-sauna is an ideal time for recovery nutrition. Increased blood flow helps deliver nutrients to muscles. Combine hydration with protein to support muscle repair.

title: Morning Energizer Session
description: Quick detox and mental clarity boost to start your day strong
rationale: Higher temperature stimulates circulation and metabolism; lower humidity creates an invigorating, crisp environment

pre-sauna-steps.title: Morning Hydration
pre-sauna-steps.description: Drink 300-400ml of water, preferably room temperature with lemon
pre-sauna-steps.info: Your body is naturally dehydrated after sleep. Hydrating before sauna kickstarts metabolism and supports the detoxification process. Lemon adds vitamin C and supports liver function.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Quick Rinse
pre-sauna-steps.description: Brief warm shower to wake up your body and cleanse skin
pre-sauna-steps.info: A quick shower removes oils accumulated during sleep and prepares your skin for optimal sweating. Warm water begins the body warming process efficiently.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Energizing Breathwork
pre-sauna-steps.description: Practice 10-15 deep breaths to oxygenate your body
pre-sauna-steps.info: Deep breathing before sauna increases oxygen saturation, preparing your cardiovascular system and enhancing the energizing effects of heat therapy. This also helps shift into a focused mental state.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 1: Metabolic Activation
sauna-steps.description: Enter sauna, sit on middle/upper bench, focus on steady breathing
sauna-steps.info: Morning heat exposure stimulates circulation and metabolic rate, helping you feel alert and energized. Increased blood flow delivers oxygen to your brain, enhancing mental clarity for the day ahead.

sauna-steps.title: Energizing Cool Down
sauna-steps.description: Step outside, take a cool/cold shower (30-60 seconds), then air dry
sauna-steps.info: Cold exposure triggers norepinephrine release, boosting alertness, focus, and mood. The temperature contrast enhances circulation and creates an energizing 'wake-up' effect that lasts hours.

sauna-steps.title: Quick Hydration
sauna-steps.description: Drink 200-250ml of water
sauna-steps.info: Replacing fluids between rounds maintains energy levels and supports the detoxification process. Staying hydrated ensures sustained mental performance throughout your morning.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 2: Deep Detox & Focus
sauna-steps.description: Re-enter sauna, add moderate steam, practice mindful breathing or mental planning
sauna-steps.info: The second heat exposure maximizes detoxification through deep sweating while promoting mental clarity. Use this time to mentally organize your day's priorities or practice focused breathing for enhanced cognitive performance.

sauna-steps.title: Invigorating Cool Down
sauna-steps.description: Cold shower (30-90 seconds), focus on face and head, then cool down naturally
sauna-steps.info: Final cold exposure solidifies the energizing effect and helps regulate body temperature for comfortable transition to daily activities. Cold water on your face stimulates the vagus nerve, enhancing alertness.

sauna-steps.title: Final Preparation
sauna-steps.description: Dress slowly, drink final water, allow body temperature to fully stabilize
sauna-steps.info: Taking time to transition prevents post-sauna sweating and ensures you feel comfortable and energized. Your enhanced circulation and mental clarity will support peak performance for hours.

sauna-steps.title: Sustained Energy Hydration
sauna-steps.description: Drink 300-400ml of water over the next 30 minutes
sauna-steps.info: Continued hydration maintains the metabolic and cognitive benefits of your morning sauna. Consider adding electrolytes or drinking green tea for sustained focus and energy throughout your morning.

title: Evening Wind-Down Session
description: Release daily stress and prepare your body for restorative sleep
rationale: Lower temperature promotes relaxation without overstimulation; moderate humidity is comfortable for extended gentle sessions

pre-sauna-steps.title: Optimal Timing
pre-sauna-steps.description: Start 1.5-2 hours before bedtime for best sleep quality
pre-sauna-steps.info: Sauna raises core body temperature temporarily. Starting early allows your body to cool down naturally before bed - this temperature drop actually promotes deeper sleep onset and quality.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Gentle Cleansing Shower
pre-sauna-steps.description: Warm, relaxing shower to wash away the day and prepare for sauna
pre-sauna-steps.info: A leisurely shower helps transition from day mode to evening relaxation. Warm water begins to release muscle tension accumulated throughout the day.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Calming Hydration
pre-sauna-steps.description: Drink 250-350ml of water or herbal tea (chamomile, lavender)
pre-sauna-steps.info: Gentle hydration prepares your body for sauna while herbal teas contain compounds that promote relaxation. Chamomile and lavender have mild sedative properties that complement evening sauna benefits.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Set Evening Intention
pre-sauna-steps.description: Take a moment to release the day's thoughts and set a relaxation intention
pre-sauna-steps.info: Mentally marking the transition from daytime productivity to evening rest helps activate your parasympathetic nervous system, preparing your mind and body for deeper relaxation.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 1: Gentle Unwinding
sauna-steps.description: Enter sauna, sit on lower or middle bench, practice slow, deep breathing
sauna-steps.info: Lower heat intensity is ideal for evening relaxation. Deep, diaphragmatic breathing activates the parasympathetic nervous system, lowering cortisol and promoting a calm, meditative state.

sauna-steps.title: Gentle Cool Down 1
sauna-steps.description: Exit sauna, cool down gradually at room temperature. Sit or lie down peacefully
sauna-steps.info: Avoid cold showers in the evening - gradual, natural cooling supports relaxation. Allow your heart rate and breathing to slow naturally. This extended rest period deepens the relaxation response.

sauna-steps.title: Mindful Hydration
sauna-steps.description: Drink 200-300ml of water slowly and mindfully
sauna-steps.info: Drinking slowly and mindfully extends the meditative quality of your session. Focus on the sensation and temperature of the water - this simple act enhances present-moment awareness.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 2: Deep Relaxation
sauna-steps.description: Re-enter sauna, add gentle steam, practice body scan or gratitude meditation
sauna-steps.info: The second round deepens muscle relaxation and stress relief. Try mentally scanning from toes to head, releasing tension in each area. Gratitude practice has been shown to improve sleep quality and emotional wellbeing.

sauna-steps.title: Extended Cool Down
sauna-steps.description: Cool down slowly and completely. Light stretching or yin yoga poses optional
sauna-steps.info: Extended cooling is crucial for sleep preparation. Gentle stretching releases any remaining tension. Your body is now primed for the temperature drop that signals sleep readiness to your brain.

sauna-steps.title: Evening Ritual Hydration
sauna-steps.description: Drink 200-300ml of herbal tea or water
sauna-steps.info: Final hydration supports overnight recovery. If choosing tea, avoid caffeinated varieties. Chamomile, passionflower, or magnesium-infused water can further enhance sleep quality.

sauna-steps.title: Transition to Sleep Mode
sauna-steps.description: Dress in comfortable sleepwear, dim lights, continue calm activities
sauna-steps.info: Your body temperature is now dropping - the ideal physiological state for sleep. Maintain the peaceful atmosphere with dim lighting and calming activities as you transition toward bedtime.

title: Mindful Presence Session
description: Guided meditation journey combining heat therapy with deep mindfulness practice
rationale: Lower temperature allows for longer meditation periods without overwhelming the body; balanced humidity supports sustained practice

pre-sauna-steps.title: Preparation Shower
pre-sauna-steps.description: Cleanse mindfully, noticing the sensation of water on your skin
pre-sauna-steps.info: Transform your shower into the first mindfulness practice. Notice temperature, pressure, and the feeling of being present in your body. This sets the tone for deeper awareness.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Intentional Hydration
pre-sauna-steps.description: Drink 300-400ml of water with full awareness
pre-sauna-steps.info: Practice present-moment awareness while hydrating. Notice the coolness, the sensation of swallowing, the feeling of nourishment. Even simple acts become meditation when done with full attention.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Grounding Ritual
pre-sauna-steps.description: Set your intention and practice grounding breathwork (voice guided)
pre-sauna-steps.info: Voice guidance will lead you through a simple grounding exercise. Connect with your body, release distractions, and set a clear intention for your meditative practice. This creates mental space for deeper work.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 1: Arriving in the Body
sauna-steps.description: Guided body scan meditation - systematically bringing awareness through your entire body
sauna-steps.info: Voice guidance leads you through a comprehensive body scan from toes to crown. The heat enhances bodily awareness, making it easier to notice subtle sensations. This practice anchors attention in the present moment and releases tension.

sauna-steps.title: Mindful Transition 1
sauna-steps.description: Walking meditation - move slowly and deliberately, noticing each sensation
sauna-steps.info: Voice prompts guide awareness to the feeling of movement, air on skin, and the cooling process. Walking meditation extends mindfulness beyond stillness, teaching presence in motion. No rushing - each step is deliberate.

sauna-steps.title: Seated Hydration Practice
sauna-steps.description: Drink 200-300ml water mindfully during silent period
sauna-steps.info: Brief silence allows you to integrate the first round's insights. Drink slowly, maintaining awareness. This short break preserves the meditative container while caring for your body's needs.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 2: Breath & Sensation
sauna-steps.description: Guided breathwork and sensation meditation - observing heat, sweat, and breath without judgment
sauna-steps.info: Voice guides you through pranayama techniques adapted for heat, then into open awareness of all sensations. The sauna's intensity becomes a meditation object itself - heat, moisture, heartbeat. Practice equanimity with discomfort.

sauna-steps.title: Mindful Transition 2
sauna-steps.description: Sitting meditation outside - observing thoughts and temperature changes without attachment
sauna-steps.info: Voice guidance supports choiceless awareness practice. Notice thoughts arising and passing like clouds. Feel your body cooling. Practice non-reactivity - simply observing the changing experience without preference.

sauna-steps.title: Contemplative Hydration
sauna-steps.description: Drink 200-300ml water with loving-kindness reflection
sauna-steps.info: As you hydrate, reflect on gratitude for your body, this practice, and this moment. Simple appreciation deepens the meditative benefits and cultivates positive mental states.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 3: Deep Presence & Insight
sauna-steps.description: Guided visualization and open awareness meditation - accessing deeper states of consciousness
sauna-steps.info: Voice guides a visualization journey, then releases you into silent open awareness. By now, your mind is quiet and receptive. The heat creates an altered state conducive to insight. Simply rest in pure presence.

sauna-steps.title: Integration & Closing
sauna-steps.description: Gentle cool down with loving-kindness meditation and practice integration
sauna-steps.info: Voice guides metta (loving-kindness) practice for self and others. This positive culmination helps integrate insights and extends benefits beyond the session. Cool down completely while cultivating compassion.

sauna-steps.title: Closing Ritual
sauna-steps.description: Final hydration with gratitude practice, seal the practice with intention
sauna-steps.info: Drink 300-400ml water over the next 20 minutes. Voice guidance offers brief closing words of dedication - directing the merit of practice toward your wellbeing and others. Carry this presence into your day.

title: Radiant Skin Renewal Session
description: Deep cleansing and rejuvenation for healthy, glowing skin
rationale: Optimal temperature for pore dilation and circulation; higher humidity helps hydrate skin and enhance product absorption

pre-sauna-steps.title: Deep Cleansing Shower
pre-sauna-steps.description: Thoroughly cleanse face and body with gentle cleanser, removing all makeup and impurities
pre-sauna-steps.info: Starting with completely clean skin allows pores to open fully and release deeper impurities during sauna. Removing makeup and surface dirt prevents clogging pores when they dilate from heat.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Gentle Exfoliation
pre-sauna-steps.description: Use a gentle body scrub or dry brush to remove dead skin cells
pre-sauna-steps.info: Pre-sauna exfoliation removes the barrier of dead cells, allowing deeper cleansing and better absorption of nutrients post-sauna. Increases circulation to skin surface, enhancing the glow effect.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Skin Hydration
pre-sauna-steps.description: Drink 400-500ml of water, ideally with vitamin C or collagen supplement
pre-sauna-steps.info: Hydrated skin from within glows better and handles heat stress more effectively. Vitamin C supports collagen production while your body temperature rises, and proper hydration prevents skin from becoming dehydrated during sweating.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Hair Protection
pre-sauna-steps.description: Tie hair up or cover with a towel, apply hair mask if desired
pre-sauna-steps.info: Protecting hair from excessive heat prevents damage and dryness. Optional: applying a deep conditioning mask during sauna lets the heat enhance absorption for shinier, healthier hair.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 1: Pore Opening & Initial Detox
sauna-steps.description: Enter sauna, sit comfortably, allow your skin to warm and pores to gradually open
sauna-steps.info: Heat causes vasodilation, increasing blood flow to skin by up to 50-70%. This delivers oxygen and nutrients while pores begin opening. The initial sweat flushes surface-level impurities and excess sebum.

sauna-steps.title: Cool Rinse 1
sauna-steps.description: Rinse with lukewarm to cool water, gently washing away released impurities
sauna-steps.info: Rinsing removes sweat and toxins released from pores. Cool water begins to tighten pores and stimulates circulation. Don't use soap yet - you'll do deeper rounds first. Pat skin gently, don't rub.

sauna-steps.title: Hydration & Antioxidants
sauna-steps.description: Drink 250-300ml of water, green tea, or antioxidant-rich beverage
sauna-steps.info: Antioxidants from green tea or berry-infused water support skin health from within. Maintaining hydration ensures your skin can continue producing healthy sweat for detoxification.

sauna-steps.title: Clay Mask Application
sauna-steps.description: Apply clay or purifying mask to face and any problem areas on body
sauna-steps.info: Applying the mask before entering allows it to work powerfully in the heat. Clay masks absorb toxins and excess oil as pores are maximally dilated. The sauna heat activates the mask's cleansing properties for deeper purification.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 2: Deep Cleansing with Steam
sauna-steps.description: Re-enter sauna, add moderate steam for enhanced pore cleansing
sauna-steps.info: Steam increases humidity, which softens skin and helps draw out deeper impurities. If you applied a mask, the heat will maximize its effectiveness, drawing out toxins and excess oil from deep within your pores.

sauna-steps.title: Mask Removal & Cool Water Therapy
sauna-steps.description: Rinse thoroughly with cool water, removing mask and sweat. Splash face with cold water 10-15 times
sauna-steps.info: Cool water closes pores, locking in benefits and preventing dirt re-entry. Cold water also reduces inflammation, tightens skin, and boosts circulation. This creates the immediate 'glow' effect. The temperature contrast stimulates collagen production.

sauna-steps.title: Beauty Hydration
sauna-steps.description: Drink 250-300ml of water with collagen peptides or hyaluronic acid supplement
sauna-steps.info: Collagen peptides support skin elasticity and hydration from within. Hyaluronic acid helps skin retain moisture. Both are most effective when consumed during periods of increased circulation.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 3: Circulation & Collagen Boost
sauna-steps.description: Final sauna round with gentle steam, focus on face and neck. Optional: apply honey or sheet mask
sauna-steps.info: Heat shock proteins produced at this stage support cellular repair and collagen synthesis. Honey is antibacterial and deeply moisturizing when applied in heat. Sheet masks supercharge hydration as heat drives ingredients deeper into skin.

sauna-steps.title: Final Cleansing & Pore Sealing
sauna-steps.description: Gentle cleanse with pH-balanced cleanser, finish with 1-2 min cold water on face and body
sauna-steps.info: Final cleanse removes all remaining impurities while skin is still soft. Extended cold exposure maximally tightens pores and reduces any inflammation. The cold also constricts blood vessels, which then rebound with increased flow - creating lasting radiance.

sauna-steps.title: Post-Sauna Skincare Ritual
sauna-steps.description: Apply toner, serum, and moisturizer while skin is still slightly damp. Don't forget neck and décolletage
sauna-steps.info: Post-sauna is the optimal time for skincare application. Pores are clean, circulation is elevated, and skin is receptive. Products absorb up to 10x better. Use hydrating serums (hyaluronic acid, vitamin C) followed by moisturizer to lock everything in. Your skin will maintain this glow for 24-48 hours.

sauna-steps.title: Skin Recovery Hydration
sauna-steps.description: Drink 400-500ml of water over the next 30 minutes
sauna-steps.info: Continued hydration maintains skin plumpness and supports the detoxification process. Skin cells are 64% water - maintaining this ensures your post-sauna glow lasts. Consider adding electrolytes to support cellular hydration.

title: Authentic Finnish Sauna Ritual
description: Traditional Finnish sauna experience with proper löyly technique and cultural practices
rationale: Traditional Finnish sauna temperatures create authentic löyly experience; humidity varies naturally with steam thrown on stones

pre-sauna-steps.title: Traditional Cleansing
pre-sauna-steps.description: Take a thorough warm shower, washing your entire body
pre-sauna-steps.info: In Finnish culture, entering the sauna clean is a matter of respect and hygiene. This ritual cleansing is both practical and symbolic, washing away the day before the sauna purification.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Hydration Preparation
pre-sauna-steps.description: Drink 300-400ml of water at room temperature
pre-sauna-steps.info: Proper hydration is essential for the intense heat you'll experience. Room temperature water is preferred in Finnish tradition as it's gentler on the system before heat exposure.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Prepare Vihta (Birch Whisk)
pre-sauna-steps.description: If using a vihta, soak it in warm water to soften the leaves
pre-sauna-steps.info: The vihta (also called vasta) is a bundle of fresh birch branches used for gentle whipping to stimulate circulation and release aromatic oils. Soaking softens the leaves and releases their beneficial compounds.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Löyly Water Preparation
pre-sauna-steps.description: Fill the water bucket and ladle, ensure they're within reach of the stones
pre-sauna-steps.info: Löyly (the steam created by water on hot stones) is the heart of Finnish sauna. Having your water prepared and accessible ensures you can create the perfect atmosphere during your session.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 1: Acclimatization
sauna-steps.description: Enter sauna, sit on lower bench, let your body adjust to the heat
sauna-steps.info: Finnish tradition emphasizes gradual warming. Start low where it's cooler (around 60-70°C) to let your cardiovascular system adapt. This prevents shock and allows you to enjoy longer sessions.

sauna-steps.title: Lake or Snow Cooling
sauna-steps.description: Cool down outside in fresh air. In tradition: lake swim or snow roll. Alternative: cold shower
sauna-steps.info: The dramatic temperature contrast is central to Finnish sauna culture. A dip in a cold lake or rolling in snow creates intense invigoration. If unavailable, a cold shower provides similar benefits - improved circulation and endorphin release.

sauna-steps.title: Rest & Hydration
sauna-steps.description: Rest completely, drink 200-300ml water, let your body stabilize
sauna-steps.info: The rest period between rounds is as important as the sauna itself. This is when your body processes the heat stress, blood pressure normalizes, and beneficial adaptations occur. Don't rush this.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 2: The Löyly Experience
sauna-steps.description: Move to middle bench. Throw 1-2 ladles of water on stones. Master the art of löyly
sauna-steps.info: Proper löyly technique: Pour water slowly onto the hottest stones, allowing each ladle to fully evaporate before adding more. The steam should rise and spread evenly. Too much water creates harsh, wet steam; too little gives no effect. This is the essence of Finnish sauna.

sauna-steps.title: Vihta Treatment
sauna-steps.description: Optional: Use birch whisk on skin with gentle patting motions while still in sauna
sauna-steps.info: The vihta massage stimulates circulation, exfoliates skin, and releases aromatic birch oils with anti-inflammatory properties. Use gentle patting and whisking motions on legs, back, and arms. The scent is incredibly refreshing and traditionally therapeutic.

sauna-steps.title: Second Cooling
sauna-steps.description: Repeat cold exposure - embrace the invigorating shock
sauna-steps.info: The second cold exposure feels even more invigorating than the first. Your body is now warmed deeply, making the contrast more pronounced. This creates a powerful sense of vitality and awakeness.

sauna-steps.title: Extended Rest
sauna-steps.description: Deep rest period, drink water, enjoy the post-sauna calm
sauna-steps.info: This extended rest is when the magic happens. Your body is in a state of deep relaxation, stress hormones are low, and endorphins are high. Many Finns consider this the best part of sauna - the profound peace afterward.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 3: The Peak Experience
sauna-steps.description: Move to upper bench for maximum heat. Create strong löyly for the authentic Finnish intensity
sauna-steps.info: The upper bench can reach 90-100°C - the true Finnish experience. When ready, create generous löyly. The wave of heat should feel intense but not painful. This is where you experience 'löylyhenki' - the spirit of the steam.

sauna-steps.title: Final Cooling & Cleansing
sauna-steps.description: Final cold exposure, then warm rinse shower to wash away sweat
sauna-steps.info: End with cold exposure followed by a gentle warm shower to wash away salt and toxins. This final cleansing prepares you for the deep relaxation phase that follows.

sauna-steps.title: Post-Sauna Tranquility
sauna-steps.description: Rest completely, hydrate slowly, embrace the profound relaxation. Optional: light refreshment
sauna-steps.info: The Finnish tradition includes extended post-sauna rest. Your body continues to benefit for hours after leaving the sauna. Hydrate with water or traditional options like beer or berry juice (after you've rehydrated). This is the time for quiet contemplation or good conversation.

title: Deep Detox & Respiratory Wellness Session
description: Maximum humidity protocol for deep detoxification and respiratory system support
rationale: Moderate temperature with high humidity maximizes detoxification through intense sweating; steam supports respiratory health and sinus drainage

pre-sauna-steps.title: Respiratory Preparation
pre-sauna-steps.description: Warm shower focusing on face and chest, practice deep nasal breathing
pre-sauna-steps.info: Warming your respiratory system with steam from the shower begins opening airways and loosening mucus. Deep nasal breathing prepares your sinuses for the intense humidity to come.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Detox Hydration
pre-sauna-steps.description: Drink 400-500ml of water with lemon and pinch of sea salt or electrolytes
pre-sauna-steps.info: Lemon supports liver function during detox, while minerals help your body maintain electrolyte balance during intense sweating. You'll lose significant fluids in this high-humidity session.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Dry Brushing
pre-sauna-steps.description: Gentle dry brushing toward the heart to stimulate lymphatic system
pre-sauna-steps.info: Dry brushing activates your lymphatic system, which is crucial for toxin removal. Brush in long strokes toward your heart to encourage lymph flow, enhancing the detoxification process.

pre-sauna-steps.title: Breathing Exercise
pre-sauna-steps.description: Practice deep diaphragmatic breathing - inhale for 4, hold for 4, exhale for 6
pre-sauna-steps.info: This breathing pattern activates your parasympathetic nervous system and prepares your lungs for the humid environment. It also helps maximize the respiratory benefits of steam.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 1: Humidity Acclimation
sauna-steps.description: Enter sauna, sit on lower bench, add water every 2 minutes for consistent high humidity
sauna-steps.info: High humidity makes moderate temperature feel more intense. Start on the lower bench where it's slightly cooler while your respiratory system adjusts to the steam. The constant moisture will begin opening your pores and airways.

sauna-steps.title: Gentle Cool Down & Rinse
sauna-steps.description: Lukewarm shower to rinse away initial toxins released through sweat
sauna-steps.info: This first rinse washes away surface toxins, salt, and impurities. Use lukewarm water - not cold - to avoid shocking your system. This allows continued detoxification without stress.

sauna-steps.title: Electrolyte Replenishment
sauna-steps.description: Drink 250-350ml water with electrolytes or coconut water
sauna-steps.info: Heavy sweating depletes sodium, potassium, and magnesium. Replacing these minerals is crucial for continued detox capacity and preventing fatigue, cramps, or headaches.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 2: Deep Detoxification
sauna-steps.description: Return to sauna, maintain maximum humidity. Focus on slow, deep breathing through your nose
sauna-steps.info: This round produces the deepest detoxification. Maximum humidity intensifies sweating while delivering steam to your deepest airways. Nasal breathing filters and warms the air, maximizing respiratory benefits and supporting sinus drainage.

sauna-steps.title: Eucalyptus Steam Treatment
sauna-steps.description: Optional: Add a few drops of eucalyptus oil to water before throwing on stones
sauna-steps.info: Eucalyptus oil released in steam has powerful decongestant and antimicrobial properties. It opens airways, fights respiratory infections, and creates an incredibly refreshing breathing experience. Use sparingly - 3-5 drops maximum.

sauna-steps.title: Toxin Removal Shower
sauna-steps.description: Thorough shower with mild soap, alternating warm and cool water
sauna-steps.info: This shower removes all sweat and released toxins from your skin, preventing reabsorption. Alternating temperatures continues to stimulate circulation and lymphatic drainage, enhancing the detox effect.

sauna-steps.title: Mineral Hydration
sauna-steps.description: Drink 300-400ml water with trace minerals or herbal detox tea
sauna-steps.info: Replenishing minerals supports your liver and kidneys in processing released toxins. Herbal teas like dandelion or milk thistle provide additional liver support during the detox process.

sauna-steps.title: Interval 3: Respiratory Clearing
sauna-steps.description: Final round with maximum steam. Practice breathing exercises: alternate nostril breathing
sauna-steps.info: This final round focuses on respiratory health. Alternate nostril breathing in the steam clears sinuses, balances nervous system, and maximizes the therapeutic effects on your respiratory system. The heat and humidity work together to clear even stubborn congestion.

sauna-steps.title: Final Cleansing & Recovery
sauna-steps.description: Thorough final shower, then rest completely to allow body to continue processing toxins
sauna-steps.info: Your body continues detoxifying for hours after leaving the sauna. This rest period allows your liver and kidneys to process mobilized toxins. Avoid eating immediately - give your body time to complete its cleansing work.

sauna-steps.title: Post-Detox Hydration & Nutrition
sauna-steps.description: Drink 500ml water over 30 minutes. Consider light fruit or vegetable juice for liver support
sauna-steps.info: Continued hydration flushes toxins from your system. Fresh vegetable juice (especially greens, beets, carrots) provides antioxidants that support your liver in processing the mobilized toxins. Avoid heavy foods for at least an hour.
